reviews.text: Close to KL Sentral Station. Small cozy rooms. Good view if your room faces the road. Complimentary breakfast, nice. Free Wifi. But intercomm was not working during my stay. Little India nearby having restaurants serving vegetarian food. Recommended for a Budget traveler.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel for Budget traveler

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is really fantastic. We got on bus from the LCCT and it dropped us off at KL Sentral.
reviews.title: A perfect location for transient visits

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got lost a bit going to the hotel because we didn't follow the pathway that most passengers used, but it was alright because we ended up in a strip of Indian restaurants serving fresh roti for MYR 2.50 in the morning. If you get lost, ask the taxi drivers, not the locals. They know all the hotels in the area.
reviews.title: good value

reviews.text: The hotel is really a good 5 min walk. From the pathway, you can see its building. If you're nearsighted, it's just behind YMCA. We arrived in the morning and we left our luggage there because our room was not yet ready. We walked back to KL Sentral to take the KTM to Batu Caves for MYR 2.
reviews.title: **security alert** possible housekeeping theft

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we returned after lunch, we saw a stall for Ice Kacang near the hotel. We saw locals enjoying this icy treat. So we had ours for "takeaway" or "bungkus". It was really tasty.
reviews.title: A very nice place to stay near KL Sentral

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights, looking for a quiet location in such a busy place as KL Sentral. Our room was clean, bed of comfortable and the windows blocked out the 24/7 action below in busy Brickfields. The included breakfast was barely OK, but then for the price a quick toast and coffee was all we needed. Would definitely stay again and opt for slightly more expensive room on higher level. Reception printed out boarding passes for a very reasonable fee. Security also seemed to be very good, although I felt comfortable in the streets around. There are so many people out and about day and night it's a good safe location.
reviews.title: Clean, quiet, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: People at the reception are competent and speak reasonable English. Breakfast is adequate and eating area on the Mezzanine floor is satisfactory. Hotel location beside the main train station (Sentral) and the Indian quarter is fine. The hotel rooms are average and the bathrooms just about achieve the 3 star grade. Not a holiday hotel but probably adequate for a short business trip or an overnight stay. A small point; I asked the receptionist to phone a local dentist for me and she said she had not got an outside phone line!! She did get a number for me and I phoned from MY ROOM..!! Very strange
reviews.title: Basic three star

reviews.text: The price of the hotel is reasonable.
reviews.title: Close to KL transport, Perfect for transiting passengers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked 2 rooms for 1 night in KL. THis hotel offers the perfect location for transiting passengers who wishes to see the city. They are located 2-5mins away to the monorail and KL Sentral Station. We were able to shop at Bukit Bintang, eat at Jalan Alor, shop at China Town and Central Market and lastly do a photo op in Petronas Twin Towers.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel and good location

reviews.text: What I liked: Cheap, Fast check-in, great service, Internet is fast, big room, comfortable bed and public transport nearby(KL Sentral major tranpo hub).
reviews.title: Lovely stay, efficient friendly staff, great rooms

reviews.text: The hotel was averagely clean, but a little bit shabby and old fashioned. The bathroom was a bit dark. The room was not too large. However, the breakfast turned out to be ok. Choices of fried rice, fried noodle, dim sum, porridge, pancake, bread-butter-jam, sauteed vegetable and fruits.
reviews.title: Average hotel in a very convenient location

reviews.text: The hotel was conveniently located in KL Sentral area. Only about 10-min walk to KL Sentral station and 5-min walk to monorail station. There's 7-Eleven store beside the hotel.
reviews.title: Convenience location at a budget

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staffs almost always looked busy, no smile............but they were quite firendly when I required assistant.
reviews.title: Just average

reviews.text: Greta location which is near the sentral train station if you are intend to travel in the public transport. 5 min walk to the train station yet without the high traffic noisy street. The room is clean and reasonably spacious.
reviews.title: Standard hotel

reviews.text: Breakfast is less than desire which you can skip and go for something else outside the hotel.
reviews.title: Budget stay at it's best

reviews.text: My opinion, looking for a hotel with a price not too expensive in the Bukit Bintang area is rather difficult, there is only 2 options, very expensive hotel or very cheap hotel. The solution is find hotel in another area with the terms close to the bus station/ MRT so easy to go everywhere. Option this time fell into Summer View hotel near KL Central & Tun Sambathan monorail station. From Tun Sambathan to KL Central is 1.20 RM, to Bukit Bintang is 1.60 RM
reviews.title: close to KL Central so easy to go everywhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From KL Central to Summer View hotel can walk about 10-15 minutes or take a taxi around 10-15 RM or use the monorail to Tun Sambathan station, and then out after 1 station.
reviews.title: Cheap and best
good place n stay
reviews.text: I ordered 2 rooms through the hotel web site. I booked a room on the top floor but the receptionist gave on the 3rd floor. fortunately she gave room faced each other
We had to carry our own luggage to our room despite there is the hotel concierge, a bit strange ...
reviews.title: Bang for your bucks!!!

reviews.text: The hotel building is good, just only when out of the elevator on the 3rd floor immediately smelt the cigarette smell, musty carpet smell and sound of crying child from another room.
reviews.title: Location, location- and cool and clean
